channel.title: +Meta on काव्ये विश्वासटिप्पन्यः

item.title: Glossary - shankar + Venetia
item.description:
AGRAHĀRA: a Brahmin settlement

AṆIMĀ: one of the śaktis (‘powers’) associated with Pārvatī, in this case a personification of the ability to shrink to the size of an atom

ARGHYA: water offered to a guest upon arrival

AŚOKA: ashoka or Saraca Asoca, a tree with red-orange flowers

BAKULA: the bullet-wood tree or Mimusops Elengi, an ornamental tree with fragrant white flowers

BHADRAKĀLĪ: another name for Kālī

BHARATA: one of Rāma’s younger brothers

item.title: Intro by shankar + venetia
item.description: A man, spirited away from his wife’s side as they slept by some mysterious women, is stranded alone and wretched in Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu. As the season of Vasanta arrives, bringing to bud love alongside the flowers and trees, the pain of separation intensifies and it is at that moment that he sees a koel, the Indian cuckoo. Invoking the bird’s sympathy, he asks it to fly to Chendamangalam in central Kerala with a message for his beloved.
